description.text: JoeRunner, T.T., and Harry play an online game.
description.html: JoeRunner, T.T., and Harry play an online game.

lines.d: A computer screen shows a video game, Hyper Galactic Battle Ducks III. The player is tomatotoe07, and the time is 0757. The player’s ship is shaped like a mouse cursor. They have a middling Physical bar, and a low Energy bar. There is a chat in the bottom left corner.

brightful On the move!

brightful Uh-oh!

sharkles5 stop spamming defaults

brightful I’m using tilt controls!
(off-panel) Ha! I berzork’d your rear energy shields!
(off-panel) Perhaps . . .
JoeRunner and T.T. are sitting next to each other at computers. JoeRunner looks very confident.
. . . but that got me enough reputation to access the Pan‐Galactic Gargle Blaster from the Retnia shop!
JoeRunner is imagining his ship blowing up another, while his duck avatar gives a thumbs up.
Say your last⁠—
JoeRunner raises his eyebrows, and a burst symbol appears above his head. It turns into a loading wheel with the text “Processing . . .” as JoeRunner stares blankly at the screen.
(off‐panel, loudly) Shoot!
(looking over, raising eyebrow) What, what is it?
T.T. raises his hand and gets an annoyed look.
Oh, heck, me too! ottohammr again?
Every day there are what, like 300 players and he keeps finding us?
I swear he’s just trolling us at this point.
A boy on another computer with long black hair and an unbuttoned polo shirt has a smug look on his face. He speaks in a textured font.
Ah, guilty as charged. It is just so funny when you guys rage.
Harry / gamer of the highest order
(surprised) Harry, you’ve been ottohammr this whole time?
The last four years, anyway. And now you are approximately 1.39729 × 10<sup>12</sup> molecules of space debris.
T.T. and Harry dap each other up.
But, my friends, it was quite an honorable battle.
(saluting) Farewell, Captain tomatotoe07. Farewell.

content.html:
Alas, poor tomatotoe07.

This page only took a month to come out instead of, like, five. There’s so much that I want to get to, and it’s a bit upsetting to me that I’ve only gotten this far, with JoeRunner and Co.’s first anniversary being in two days (April 1). This page especially took a lot of effort⁠—the most yet⁠—due to its length.

Only about 60% of the draft I wrote back on . . . checks May 25, 2021? I really am behind. ahem Only about 60% of the original draft is in this final version. None of these pages so far are super faithful to that draft⁠—I wrote them when I was around 14 years old, and of course my dialogue has changed a lot in two years of my teenage life. It means the same thing, but it’s expanded and, dare I say, funnier. Assuming it’s funny at all.

I have 30 more pages drafted out, and while undoubtedly not all of it will stay, I’m excited to get through them. I’ve decided that I can get a comic done every week, posted on Thursday, while still doing school. So I’ll try it, and we’ll see how it goes.

Once again, I so sincerely appreciate everyone who reads my silly, medium–low quality webcomic. I hope that you’ve enjoyed them regardless.

—⁠ ⁠Gabriel / gabl
